newsitem.title: UK: European jet fuel premiums steady in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: European jet fuel premiums steady in slow trade.

text.p: Jet fuel prices in Europe eased in line with softer IPE futures on Monday but premiums were holding steady, traders said.
NWE IPE futures were trading down $5.50 at $228.75 a tonne on unusually fine weather in Europe and news that two U.S. refineries are increasing distillate production.

Jet barge premiums were notionally steady at Nov IPE +$32/33, unchanged from Monday. Cargoes were Nov IPE +$30/32 in the north and notionally about Nov IPE +$16 in the Med. Traders said the market was in balance and fairly well supplied for October.
